metadata.title: CVE-2024-48991 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
Qualys discovered that needrestart, before version 3.8, allows localattackers to execute arbitrary code as root by winning a race condition andtricking needrestart into running their own, fake Python interpreter(instead of the system's real Python interpreter). The initial security fix(6ce6136) introduced a regression which was subsequently resolved(42af5d3).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-48991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

needrestart - 3.4-6ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: needrestart package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4-6ubuntu0.1+esm1').
